summary: The Energy Efficiency for Affordable Housing Act (S. 2638) amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase the low-income housing credit for rehabilitation expenditures of buildings that achieve enhanced energy performance. It defines "enhanced energy performance" and provides definitions for qualified retrofit plans, baseline energy usage intensity, and qualified professionals. The bill also provides a special rule for buildings in high-cost areas that achieve enhanced energy performance.  The amendments apply to buildings with credit allocations after December 31, 2025.
